name: The Engineering Company
slogan: Enabling inventors and engineers to design hardware at the speed of their imagination
description: Designing robots, wind turbines, rockets is expensive, slow, repetitive and can only be done by experts. Our technology massively accelerates design and lowers economic and technical barriers to entry, making inconceivable technologies possible.The Engineering Company is reinventing the way we develop complex hardware. Unlike software, industrial hardware is still designed at the lowest level, taking years and millions to develop. We are building the software abstraction layer that will one day power all industrial design and development.

jobs.title: Open Application
jobs.description:
**Do you like challenges? Do you want to have a meaningful impact on society? Do you want to work with the best talent in London, for a company with a clear, well defined vision?**

We're always looking for the most talented people to join our team. If you don't see a role that fits your skills, please reach out and we'll let you know if there's anything coming up!

**| About Us**
The Engineering Company is building a next-generation design tool for mechanical engineering. From rocket engines to wind turbines and robots, designing engineering products is expensive, slow and can only be done by experts. Our software massively accelerates design and lowers barriers to entry, making inconceivable advancements possible.

We are software and mechanical engineers that have worked on the cutting edge of industry, at places including Autodesk Research, McLaren Automotive and F1, Rolls Royce Aerospace. We work in an incredibly fast paced environment with a laser focus on executing quickly to deliver the maximum amount of value to our users, customers and the world.

We are a tight-knit, motivated and supportive family: we’re all motivated by working towards the same goal, and we want the world to join us in our mission. We are creating a new grassroots movement: a global group of engineers, hobbyists and enthusiasts passionate about working with the latest ground breaking tools, to change the world for the better.


**| Core Behaviours**
• Relentless focus: Strong problem-solving skills based on continual experimentation, patience and running mini-tests.
• Delivery oriented: you commit to and deliver to deadlines, regardless of the effort required.
• Strong empathy: you can communicate well and resolve issues positively and quickly.
• Self-motivated: You can work independently in a fast-paced environment, with strong attention to detail.
• Continuous improvement: You strive to constantly deliver to a higher standard.
• Driven by positive change: You care about making the world a better place and work consistently to achieve this through daily positive interactions.

jobs.title: Community and Social Media Manager
jobs.description:
**Do you like challenges? Do you want to have a meaningful impact on society? Do you want to work with the best talent in London, for a company with a clear, well defined vision?**

**The Engineering Company is looking for a creative, passionate and driven Community and Social Media Manager to join our team and own the creation of a new, revolutionary engineering community.**

**| About Us**
The Engineering Company is building a next-generation design tool for mechanical engineering. From rocket engines to wind turbines and robots, designing engineering products is expensive, slow and can only be done by experts. Our software massively accelerates design and lowers barriers to entry, making inconceivable advancements possible.

We are software and mechanical engineers that have worked on the cutting edge of industry, at places including Autodesk Research, McLaren Automotive and F1, Rolls Royce Aerospace. We work in an incredibly fast paced environment with a laser focus on executing quickly to deliver the maximum amount of value to our users, customers and the world.

We are a tight-knit, motivated and supportive family: we’re all motivated by working towards the same goal, and we want the world to join us in our mission. We are creating a new grassroots movement: a global group of engineers, hobbyists and enthusiasts passionate about working with the latest ground breaking tools, to change the world for the better.

**| The Role**
*Key Responsibilities:*
	1. lead the strategic planning for expansion, engagement, content creation and distribution;
	2. deliver world-class content and experiences that delight our community and foster brand loyalty, while engaging personally with the community every day; 
	3. use state of the art analytics and monitoring to constantly adapt and improve your strategies for increased engagement and user love.
	
To support the organic and rapid growth of our community, you will devise mechanisms that empower people to create their own local chapters, while remaining as part of the core TEC family. You will promote a community feel by building and fostering inter-member social relationships through social media, Slack, Email campaigns, meetups, events and competitions. You will moderate community content to ensure civility, openness and friendly discourse.

*Benefits:*
We offer a competitive salary, equity and benefits package including an unlimited development budget, unlimited and flexible holiday and a cycle-to-work scheme, among others.
As we grow as a community and a team, you will have the opportunity to grow into a leadership role, hiring your own team to support continued community growth.

**| About you**
You are the single public face of TEC for our users - the link that makes them feel individually valued as of the family.
You love helping people and get a thrill from enabling positive interactions inside and outside the community. You have a high degree of empathy and adaptability, and a high attention to detail. You are witty, personable, relatable and resilient - you can confidently manage negative interactions and turn them into positive outcomes for the community and for TEC.
You have some experience building and maintaining a new community. You must have detailed knowledge about engineering, hackspace and enthusiast community, industry and the ability to research and stay on top of the latest trends and developments.
Ideally, you are a maker / hacker / engineer yourself, with deep knowledge of the problem we’re solving.

**| Required Skills**
* Strong communicator across all mediums
* Demonstrable experience of building an open source community
* Demonstrable experience of relevant content creation (can be in partnership with other team members)
* Proven track record of proactively managing conflict in social media
* Experience developing and iterating Community and Social Media strategies
* Experience using interaction-tracking software and analysing the results to adapt strategies
* Excellent multitasking skills

**| Preferred Skills**
* Some knowledge of Public Relations
* Some knowledge of marketing strategies
* Strong knowledge of the engineering industry

**| Nice-to-have Skills**
* Experience running events / competitions
* Knowledge of hardware / hacking / making / mechanical engineering
* Knowledge of existing engineering communities (like RobotWars, Rocketry or Aerospace clubs)


**| Soft Skills**
• Relentless focus: Strong problem-solving skills based on continual experimentation, patience and running mini-tests.
• Delivery oriented: you commit to and deliver to deadlines, regardless of the effort required.
• Strong empathy: you can communicate well and resolve issues positively and quickly.
• Self-motivated: You can work independently in a fast-paced environment, with strong attention to detail.
• Continuous improvement: You strive to constantly deliver to a higher standard.
• Driven by positive change: You care about making the world a better place and work consistently to achieve this through daily positive interactions.

jobs.title: (Senior) Back End / Cloud Software Engineer
jobs.description:
**Do you like challenges? Do you want to have a meaningful impact on society? Do you want to work with the best talent in London, for a company with a clear, well defined vision?**


**The Engineering Company is looking for an energised, passionate and dedicated Back-End Engineer to join our team and help us change the engineering industry.**

**| About Us**
The Engineering Company is building a next-generation design tool for mechanical engineering. From rocket engines to wind turbines and robots, designing engineering products is expensive, slow and can only be done by experts. Our software massively accelerates design and lowers barriers to entry, making inconceivable advancements possible. 
We are software and mechanical engineers that have worked on the cutting edge of industry, at places including Autodesk Research, McLaren Automotive, Rolls Royce Aerospace. We care about and value each other for our unique perspective and contributions.

**| The Role**
Key Responsibilities
Architect and build the complete cloud backend software and infrastructure for our platform
Implement and own best Dev-Ops practices to ensure maximum team productivity.

We are looking for someone to architect and build the cloud backend software and infrastructure for our groundbreaking tool for mechanical engineers. You will push our technology to its limits, to create a highly accessible product that inspires hundreds of thousands of mechanical engineers to develop the products of the future. With the technology that you develop, mechanical engineering will become intuitive, accessible, fun, and will unlock incredible advancements for society.

Our tech stack includes flow based programming, C++, Golang, Python and Javascript.

*Benefits:*
We offer a competitive salary, equity and benefits package including an unlimited development budget, unlimited and flexible holiday and a cycle-to-work scheme, among others.
As we grow as a community and a team, you will have the opportunity to grow into a leadership role, hiring your own team to support continued community growth.

**| About you**
You are a Back End Engineer with experience developing the software for complex cloud-based applications. You have some full-stack experience, and you have worked in a fast-paced environment where quality and speed of delivery are key. You thrive with responsibility, and constantly go the extra mile to deliver the right thing.

**| Impact**
At TEC, we’re motivated by the fulfilment of solving hard problems to achieve something extraordinary. As an early hire, you’ll be directly responsible for developing the technology that will set the foundations of the next era of engineering companies and will change the daily life of thousands of engineers.
 
**| Required Skills**
•	5 - 10 years experience developing backend software in a suitable language(s)
•	Detailed knowledge of cloud infrastructure and architecture (AWS / GoogleCloud etc)
•	Demonstrable experience with at least two programming languages
•	Some demonstrable full-stack development experience

**| Preferred Skills**
•	Front-end development experience

**| Nice-to-have Skills**
•	Built technologies quickly from scratch (e.g. hackathons, weekend projects)
•	Knowledge of existing engineering software packages (CAD / FEA / CAM / Simulation)
•	Experience with WebGL / 3D graphics

**| Soft Skills**
*•	Relentless focus:* Strong problem-solving skills based on continual experimentation, patience and running mini-tests
*•	Delivery oriented:* you commit to and deliver to deadlines, regardless of the effort required.
*•	Strong user empathy:* you can communicate well with non-technical people and assess the best way to deliver what they’re really asking for.
*•	Self-motivated:* You can work independently in a fast-paced environment, with strong attention to detail
*•	Continuous improvement:* You foster a positive learning environment across multiple teams. You go out of your way to help others achieve and improve as a team.
*•	Driven by positive change:* You care about building technology that delivers a real-world impact to many people.
